conclusion: Coil ABCO has area = 0.4 m², Magnetic field B = 0.1 T in positive x-direction, Coil rotates 60° downward around z-axis from initial position
Coil ABCO initially lies in the xz-plane, normal vector to this coil is along the y-axis
Initial magnetic flux Φ_i = B * A * cos(90°) = 0.1 * 0.4 * 0 = 0 Wb
Rotation moves normal vector 60° from y-axis toward negative x-axis in xy-plane, new angle between normal vector and x-axis becomes θ_f = 90° - 60° = 30°
Final magnetic flux Φ_f = B * A * cos(30°) = 0.1 * 0.4 * 0.866 = 0.03464 Wb
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ = Φ_f - Φ_i = 0.03464 - 0 = 0.03464 Wb
The change in magnetic flux passing through the coil is approximately 0.035 Wb
